item.title: Elem teacher Hicks prevails in SD40 Democratic Party primary
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Carri Hicks had a baby half-way through her campaign for the Senate District 40 Democratic primary nomination and won anyway. That’s determination. And it was expressed in a lot of door-knocking and pinching pennies in a campaign funded mostly with small donations from an increasing cadre of supporters. The better-known opponent, Danielle Ezell, has far […]

The post Elem teacher Hicks prevails in SD40 Democratic Party primary appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Guild seen – later admits to – removing opponent’s campaign signs
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Democrat Tom Guild was seen pulling up an opponent’s campaign signs just as the afternoon rush hour was starting in Oklahoma City Monday. Guild is one of six contenders for the Democratic Party’s nomination to run for Congressional 5th District seat in November. The opponent whose signs Guild was pulling up was Kendra Horn, one […]

The post Guild seen – later admits to – removing opponent’s campaign signs appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Gloves off in eastside HD99 Dem primary – Davis vs. Pittman
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Steve Davis shifted the tone and level of intensity of the four-way Democratic Primary in the eastside HD 99 race Friday with a Facebook Live attack on Ajay Pittman. “I will not let anyone misguide this community,” Davis said in the live video around noon. And connecting Pittman with her mother, Sen. Anastasia Pittman, Davis […]

item.title: Mass of campaign signs signal start of early voting
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
A mass of campaign signs seemed to spring up overnight blocks north and south of the entrance to the Oklahoma County Election Board in Oklahoma City Thursday morning. Primary election early voting started Thursday morning in Oklahoma and will continue through Saturday for those willing to travel to their county election boards. This year even […]

The post Mass of campaign signs signal start of early voting appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Sen Lankford’s office picketed over border child separations
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
A group protesting the current U.S. policy of separating children from families attempting to cross the border gathered outside Senator James Lankford’s OKC offices Monday. Protesters called the policy “egregious,” “torture,” “a violation of human rights,” and “the height of evil.” And Native Americans at the protest said the policy was “not something new” and […]

The post Sen Lankford’s office picketed over border child separations appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Who is this man pulling up Brad Reeves campaign signs? – UPDATED
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Free Press witnessed a man pulling up Brad Reeves for Oklahoma County Commissioner campaign signs near N. Classen Boulevard and NW 7th Street Tuesday.* Was he with the Reeves campaign? It seemed not, considering his behavior and statements just minutes before we caught him on camera removing the signs. He and a woman pulled up […]

item.title: East side pastor chosen to fill interim Ward 7 OKC Council seat
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
The Oklahoma City Council chose Pastor Lee E. Cooper, Jr. for interim Ward 7 Council member Tuesday after considering 18 applications for the post. He will be sworn in at the beginning of the next Council meeting June 19 and take his seat immediately. Cooper has already been involved in city government serving as the […]

The post East side pastor chosen to fill interim Ward 7 OKC Council seat appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: System “absolutely rigged” says Our Revolution rally speaker
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
“You know what? The system is rigged. It is absolutely rigged. But we can unrig it if we are willing to do something.” It was a key point about the power of political activism made by Nina Turner, nationally-known political commentator who spoke at the Our Revolution Oklahoma rally Thursday in Oklahoma City. A year […]

The post System “absolutely rigged” says Our Revolution rally speaker appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: Okla Democratic Party staff first in nation to unionize
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Non-managerial staff members of the Oklahoma Democratic Party are the first in the nation among state Democratic Party headquarters to officially unionize with a signed contract. And they did it with the full support of management and party leadership. It is a significant move for those who toil in the engine rooms of party politics […]

The post Okla Democratic Party staff first in nation to unionize appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.

item.title: OKC senator picked by state Democrats to lead caucus
item.dc:creator: Brett Dickerson
item.description:
Oklahoma Senate Democrats elected Senator Kay Floyd, D-Oklahoma City, to be their next caucus leader for the 57th Oklahoma Legislature after John Sparks, D-Norman, ended his 12-year term last week. She began her conversation withÂ Free Press by phone Monday by praising outgoing caucus leader Sparks as one who has been “strong and consistent.” “He’s been […]

The post OKC senator picked by state Democrats to lead caucus appeared first on Oklahoma City Free Press.
